title: CJI 2 final sales

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: CJI 2 final sales
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Settlement documents for the Craig Jones Invitational 2, held at the Thomas & Mack Center on August 30–31, 2025
- Final ticket sales broken out by seating level (platinum, gold, silver, etc)
- Final event cost as paid by the licensee
- Any contract amendments attached to the original booking contract

This is the event: https://www.flograppling.com/articles/14514559-b-team-wins-1m-prize-defeats-new-wave-at-cji-2-in-razor-thin-decision

If the requested documents have not yet been finalized, please hold this request until they are ready, or let me know when to re-file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

title: Request for Records – Christan Micah Moore

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Records – Christan Micah Moore
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records pertaining to the arrest of Christan Micah Moore (DOB: 11/28/2002), who was arrested on May 20, 2025 by Main Jail, Broward County, Florida. Specifically, I am seeking:

All body-worn camera footage, dash camera recordings, and surveillance video related to this arrest.

Copies of all 911 call recordings, CAD reports, and dispatch logs connected to this incident.

The arrest report, incident reports, and any probable cause affidavits.

A complete list of charges filed, including statutes cited, court case numbers, and associated documents.

Booking information, including intake notes, property/evidence logs, and holding records.

The arrest information reflects charges of multiple counts of Premeditated Murder (First Degree) under Statute 782.04-1a1, including references to attempted murder in the first degree.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Baxter Price

title: FOIA Request – Records Concerning the Arrest of Tarique Smith on August 21, 2025

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FOIA Request – Records Concerning the Arrest of Tarique Smith on August 21, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all available records related to the arrest of Tarique Smith (DOB: 11/06/1997), which occurred on August 21, 2025, in Broward County, Florida. Specifically, I am seeking access to:

911 call recordings, dispatch logs, and CAD reports connected to this incident.

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage, dash camera video, and in-car recordings generated by responding deputies.

Incident reports, arrest affidavits, and use-of-force reports related to this case.

For reference, the charges listed at booking included:

DUI Causing Death to Any Human (Statute: 316.193-3c3a)

DUI Causing Death to Any Human (Statute: 316.193-3c3a)

Vehicular Homicide – Person or Viable Fetus (Statute: 782.071-1a)

Driving with No Valid DL Causing Death/Serious Injury (Statute: 322.34-6a)

DUI & Serious Bodily Injury to Another (Statute: 316.193-3c2)

DUI with Damage to Property or Person of Another (Statute: 316.193-3c1)

DUI with Damage to Property or Person of Another (Statute: 316.193-3c1)

DUI with Damage to Property or Person of Another (Statute: 316.193-3c1)

Reckless Driving – Damage to Person or Property (Statute: 316.192-3c1)

Reckless Driving – Damage to Person or Property (Statute: 316.192-3c1)

Reckless Driving – Damage to Person or Property (Statute: 316.192-3c1)

Reckless Driving – Damage to Person or Property (Statute: 316.192-3c1)

These details are provided to assist your office in identifying the requested materials.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Baxter Price

title: FOIA Request – Records Relating to the Arrest of Samuel Romerosanabria

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of all available records relating to the arrest of Samuel Romerosanabria (DOB: 04/05/1998), which took place on August 16, 2025 at approximately 5:11 PM in Dallas County, Texas.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage and dashboard camera footage from officers involved.

Any and all 911 call recordings and dispatch logs associated with this incident.

The incident reports, arrest reports, and supplemental reports connected to this arrest.

Booking records, including mugshot and intake documentation.

The charges at the time of arrest included:

Driving While Intoxicated with Open Alcohol Container (Bond: $1,000)

Evading Arrest or Detention with a Motor Vehicle (Bond: $15,000)

Possession of Controlled Substance PG 1 < 1G (Insufficient Bond)

Unlicensed Carrying Weapon (Bond: $1,500)

Illegal Alien

This request is made to ensure full transparency and access to public records under the Texas Public Information Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Baxter Price

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Rayal Francine Malla Arrest Report – Bernalillo County (08/28/2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

the arrest report, booking sheet, incident reports, 911 call recordings, and any available body-worn camera or dash camera footage related to the arrest of Rayal Francine Malla on August 28, 2025, at approximately 5:17 AM in Bernalillo County, New Mexico.

The charges associated with this arrest are:

Aggravated DWI (Refuse Testing) – 1st Offense (Statute 66-08-102(D)(3))

Speeding (Over by 1–10) (Statute 66-07-301).

Please provide all responsive records that would help identify and document the circumstances of this arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Baxter Price

title: Correspondence with Ocean Exploration Trust

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Correspondence with Ocean Exploration Trust
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All correspondence between NOAA and Ocean Exploration Trust and/or the Nautilus Exploration Program generated from May 1, 2025, until the time this request is ultimately fulfilled.

Please include as responsive:

1. Communications - any and all communications with Ocean Exploration Trust representatives, which may include:

• postal mail
• reports
• bulletins
• agreements
• memorandums of understanding
• meeting agendas or minutes
• presentations
• phone logs
• chats and meeting logs from virtual meeting and collaboration platforms (including Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Slack, WebEx, and similar platforms)
• text messages (including messages from default texting applications or encrypted messaging apps such as Signal or WhatsApp)
• emails (including body, subject line, and any and all attachments contained therein) between NOAA and @oceanexplorationtrust.org email domains

The category for this request is Media. I am a journalist with work that has appeared in Slate, Sierra, Floodlight and other publications, and I am requesting this information in that capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by email attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. Please provide a tracking number and an estimated date of completion for the responsive documents.

Sincerely,

Elyse Hauser

title: USS Liberty: Form Required to Sign to Receive Financial Compensation
tags: israeli attack on the uss liberty

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Form Required to Sign to Receive Financial Compensation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our ship on June 8, 1967, and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org]

In or around 1968, the US government issued financial compensation checks to some survivors of the attack on our ship.

In order to receive that compensation, the recipient had to sign an agreement that whatever the compensation amount was, it was the only monetary compensation the recipient would ask for.

We are asking for copies of the completed form each USS Liberty recipient was required to sign prior to receiving the disbursement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Form Required to Sign to Receive Financial Compensation
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Meadors:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
foia@nara.gov.  We received your request on September 2, 2025.  Your
request states:

*I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our
ship on June 8, 1967, and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS
Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org
<https://ussliberty.org>]  In or around 1968, the US government issued
financial compensation checks to some survivors of the attack on our
ship.  In order to receive that compensation, the recipient had to sign an
agreement that whatever the compensation amount was, it was the only
monetary compensation the recipient would ask for.  We are asking for
copies of the completed form each USS Liberty recipient was required to
sign prior to receiving the disbursement.   *

Our office handles FOIA and Privacy Act requests for NARA’s operational records
(records created by this agency).  Because your FOIA request is for records
that may be archival records (records created by or originated in a
different agency but that may have been transferred to the legal custody of
NARA), we are forwarding it by this email to our Office of Research
Services, Textual Reference (RR2RR) staff who handle FOIA requests for
textual archival records.

That office will assign your request a tracking number and respond directly
to you. In the future, if you need to follow up with that office directly,
please contact them at the address below, or electronically via email
(email is preferred).

National Archives and Records Administration
Research Services, Textual Reference Branch (RR2RR)
8601 Adelphi Road, Room 2400
College Park, MD 20740

Phone: 301-837-3091
Fax: 301-837-1752
Email: archives2reference@nara.gov

For your reference, a copy of your request is below.

Please visit our website at www.archives.gov/foia for further information
about making a FOIA request to NARA.  On our main website,
www.archives.gov, you
can learn more about the resources we offer to the public, and you can
access our online catalog.

Sincerely,

<https://www.archives.gov/>

  Ashley Bryan

  Government Information Specialist

  Operational FOIA and Access Division

  College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001

  301-837-3642

   <https://www.archives.gov/foia>   <foia@nara.gov>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/contacts>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/electronic-reading-room>
<https://www.archives.gov/ogis/resources>


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <192310-98143995@requests.muckrock.com>
Date: Mon, Sep 1, 2025 at 9:57 PM
Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Form Required to
Sign to Receive Financial Compensation
To: <foia@nara.gov>



Nat'l Archives & Records Admin
FOIA Office
Room 3110
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, MD 20740

September 1, 2025

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our
ship on June 8, 1967, and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS
Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org]

In or around 1968, the US government issued financial compensation checks
to some survivors of the attack on our ship.

In order to receive that compensation, the recipient had to sign an
agreement that whatever the compensation amount was, it was the only
monetary compensation the recipient would ask for.

We are asking for copies of the completed form each USS Liberty recipient
was required to sign prior to receiving the disbursement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform
me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer
the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or
CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I
look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business
days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnational-archives-and-records-administration-129%252Fuss-liberty-form-required-to-sign-to-receive-financial-compensation-192310%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540nara.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2m25DYSS4CKwAWl7gywOAFo%3A1utGGd%3AA1Uclh4lTh9kEG-evi_9KLZNvxEtgcupxWuQ1GO-bZk

If prompted for a passcode, please enter:
HNBXRRGA

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 192310-98143995@requests.muckrock.com

PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS
For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 192310
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is
being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share,
and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed
(i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the
department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

title: North Haven Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for Arrest of Christian Senberg (Enticement of a Minor, July 2025)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: North Haven Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for Arrest of Christian Senberg (Enticement of a Minor, July 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera footage from North Haven Police officers during the investigation and arrest of Christian Senberg in July 2025 on charges of enticement of a minor and risk of injury to a child.

Also, any 911 call recordings, CAD call logs, and radio dispatch traffic associated with this case.

Please include video from all officers on scene, from initial contact through arrest and booking.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Blaise

title: Property Seizure/Forfeiture

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Property Seizure/Forfeiture
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Metadata from the property inventory system underlying the property seizure/forfeiture form CPD-34.524 including recovered date, RD number, inventory number, ID number, description of property, inventory type, IUCR, state charges, beat of recovery, status (i.e. hold for investigation, property available for return to owner, to be disposed of, etc.), statute, statute description, and whether or not the property is in CPD possession for all property inventoried between January 1, 2001 to today.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Filed Requests

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Filed  Requests, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT2aAhmhBYiUcSShAuSz-2Fsuc8QsVv36mciHGQCY-2FePau7DoM_UWDSOrZEijaH9JO2WegJuyV33fytFuJr9UrxX-2BEkSd0OhiEZlbH94-2Begr56SHxELFlQdQCtN6co3u62SyvCckHKEDCvSACnJuUJ2VqszRI7SuOtqDAFT4-2BJUPCJOIikuuK8FFNKwbfXlMiWV6kpvC0DPm0zds7p2voKl7LN9smYSCIYos-2F-2F5w7iea40MsYl-2B5Ps3yFqQ0ipS-2Bde6-2FyI1G7nnHKymkXFmha8Iz6hOOFM-3D) Chicago Public Records portal! (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT2aAhmhBYiUcSShAuSz-2Fsuc8QsVv36mciHGQCY-2FePaujGjb_UWDSOrZEijaH9JO2WegJuyV33fytFuJr9UrxX-2BEkSd0OhiEZlbH94-2Begr56SHxELFlQdQCtN6co3u62SyvCckNU7L1Q0PCRSRefPVspoJKwAVnbdF1a0K7eOB39CXUqFk07y57SjeJU3Hcf3kDny5HlAexV-2B3htx9F3gnF4VbIx77l97xx6BhomcsE1p5ulvokgNRS8t63UL3pqpY8QB9Vvb3JjUbdHMjNu4LNKwdio-3D) 
 Login: 192305-63310554@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, please request a Temporary Password using the Forgot Password option on the login screen. 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Daily (or in the most disaggregated form) individual PD employee absence logs for each date from January 1, 2014 - present, including employee name, job title and rank, badge number, status as a sworn/uniform vs. civilian employee, reason for time off (such as an absence "type" or "code") and the quantity of time logged for the absence.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Zachary J. Watson

title: Toledo Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for August 10, 2025 Welfare Check (13 Children Found in Unsafe Conditions)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Toledo Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for August 10, 2025 Welfare Check (13 Children Found in Unsafe Conditions)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera footage from Toledo Police officers responding on August 10, 2025 to a welfare check/animal complaint at a residence on Raymer Boulevard, Toledo, OH, where officers discovered 13 children living in unsafe and unsanitary conditions.

Any associated 911 call recordings, CAD call logs, and radio dispatch audio related to this incident.

Please include video from all officers on scene.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Daniel Wilkinson

title: North Haven Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for Arrest of Christian Senberg (Enticement of a Minor, July 2025)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: North Haven Police – Bodycam & 911 Records for Arrest of Christian Senberg (Enticement of a Minor, July 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera footage from North Haven Police officers during the investigation and arrest of Christian Senberg in July 2025 on charges of enticement of a minor and risk of injury to a child.

Also, any 911 call recordings, CAD call logs, and radio dispatch traffic associated with this case.

Please include video from all officers on scene, from initial contact through arrest and booking.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Wilkinson
